org.openbase.bco.authentication.lib

Class CredentialStore

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openbase.bco.authentication.lib.CredentialStore
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MockClientStore, MockCredentialStore

    public class CredentialStore
extends Object
    This class provides access to the storage of login credentials.
    Author:
    Constantin Romankiewicz

    • Constructor Detail

      • CredentialStore

        public CredentialStore(String filename)

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
          throws org.openbase.jul.exception.InitializationException
        Throws:
        org.openbase.jul.exception.InitializationException

      • saveStore

        protected void saveStore()
        Stores the credentials in a protobuf JSON file.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Return whether the internal map is empty.
        Returns:
        true if no client/user is registered

      • hasOnlyServiceServer

        public boolean hasOnlyServiceServer()
        Return whether the internal map only holds one entry for the service server.
        Returns:
        true if no client/user is registered except the service server.

      • hasEntry

        public boolean hasEntry(String id)
        Determines if there is an entry with given id.
        Parameters:
        id - the id to check
        Returns:
        true if existent, false otherwise

      • getFirstEntry

        public AbstractMap.SimpleEntry<String,rst.domotic.authentication.LoginCredentialsType.LoginCredentials> getFirstEntry()
        Get an entry by the specified index. Usage only makes sense when there is only one entry in the credentialStore. Else an arbitrary entry would be returned.
        Returns:
        Returns null if the index would result in a NullPointerException.

      • removeEntry

        public void removeEntry(String id)
        Removes entry from credentialStore given id.
        Parameters:
        id - the credentials to remove

      • getCredentials

        public byte[] getCredentials(String userId)
                      throws org.openbase.jul.exception.NotAvailableException
        Get the encrypted login credentials for a given user.
        Parameters:
        userId - ID of the user whose credentials should be retrieved.
        Returns:
        The encrypted credentials, if they could be found.
        Throws:
        org.openbase.jul.exception.NotAvailableException - If the user does not exist in the credentials storage.

      • setCredentials

        public void setCredentials(String userId,
                           byte[] credentials)
        Sets the login credentials for a given user. If there is already an entry in the storage for this user, it will be replaced. Otherwise, a new entry will be created.
        Parameters:
        userId - ID of the user to modify.
        credentials - New encrypted credentials.

      • addCredentials

        public void addCredentials(String id,
                           byte[] credentials,
                           boolean admin)
        Adds new credentials to the credentialStore.
        Parameters:
        id - id of client or user
        credentials - password, public or private key
        admin - admin flag

      • isAdmin

        public boolean isAdmin(String userId)
                throws org.openbase.jul.exception.NotAvailableException
        Tells whether a given user has administrator permissions.
        Parameters:
        userId - ID of the user whose credentials should be retrieved.
        Returns:
        Boolean value indicating whether the user has administrator permissions.
        Throws:
        org.openbase.jul.exception.NotAvailableException - If the user does not exist in the credentials storage.

      • setAdmin

        public void setAdmin(String userId,
                     boolean isAdmin)
              throws org.openbase.jul.exception.NotAvailableException
        Changes the admin flag of an entry.
        Parameters:
        userId - user to change flag of
        isAdmin - boolean whether user is admin or not
        Throws:
        org.openbase.jul.exception.NotAvailableException - Throws if there is no user given userId

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
